data.event: Main highways Include: Minnesota State Highway 62 (west) Nobles County Road 1 Dundee was established in 1879 when the St. Paul and Sioux City Railway Company built a branch line, then known as the Heron Lake & Black Hills Railroad.

event.title: was surveyed and platted in July 1879

data.event: The town was surveyed and platted in July 1879, and construction of a depot began on August 13.
The town was surveyed and platted in July 1879, and construction of a depot began on August 13.
Mr. G. Foils moved to town and assumed duties of stationmaster on September 1.
He was also named postmaster when a post office was established on November 1, 1879.

event.title: was opened in the spring of 1880

data.event: The first business was opened in the spring of 1880 by F. D. Lindquist and H. A. Scherlie.
A census taken on December 23, 1897, gave the village a population of 187.

event.title: petitioned for incorporation, and on January 4, 1898

data.event: At this time, citizens petitioned for incorporation, and on January 4, 1898, the county commissioners granted their request.
A special election was held on February 15, and on March 11, 1898, the Dundee council met for the first time.
A special election was held on February 15, and on March 11, 1898, the Dundee council met for the first time.
